#Text=How to Make a Glowstick
#Text=Those glowing Mountain Dew videos with peroxide and baking soda are all hoaxes .

#Text=To truly make a glowstick without breaking an already - made glowstick and shoving its contents into a tube ( also known as cheating ) , you 've got ta let your inner scientist out ( along with a few dollars ) .
#Text=If you 're still curious , read on .
#Text=This is fun for anyone and everyone .
#Text=Method One of Two : Using Luminol
#Text=Put on protective glasses .
#Text=In addition , wear gloves to protect your skin .
#Text=It 's also a good idea to not wear your Sunday best .
#Text=Throw on some old clothes or put a smock over clothes you want protected .
#Text=Some of this stuff is dangerous -- this experiment is not meant for children !
#Text=Listen up , kids : You 'll be working with a solution that 's near a 12 on the pH scale .
#Text=That basically means do n't swallow it , do n't put it in your eyes , do n't bathe in it , and do n't really expose yourself to it directly at all .
#Text=Got it ?
#Text=Moving on .
#Text=Combine 50 milliliters of hydrogen peroxide and a liter of distilled water in a mixing bowl .
#Text=A ceramic bowl will work best , but plastic works too .
#Text=Use funnels , measuring tubes , and basters to keep everything well - measured and well away from you .
#Text=Hydrogen peroxide is used to replace the luminol 's nitrogen atoms with oxygen .
#Text=When that happens , all the substances create a rave and start partying and electrons fly everywhere and what results ?
#Text=The glow .
#Text=Mix .2 grams of luminol , 4 grams of sodium carbonate , .4 grams of copper sulfate , .5 grams of ammonium carbonate and 1 liter ( 0.3 US gal ) of distilled water in a second bowl .
#Text=It is important not to touch the luminol .
#Text=Use a funnel to make everything safe and easy .
#Text=Unfortunately , these hazardous chemicals will not float freely in mid-air like this graphic suggests .
#Text=Yep , unless you 're a coroner or some sort of crazy spy / criminologist you probably do n't have this stuff lying around the house ( hopefully not ... ) .
#Text=If you 're dead set on starting your own glowstick business ( worse ideas exist ) , try websites like Alfa Aesar [ 1 ] or Sigma Aldrich [ 2 ] for supplies .
#Text=Mix everything well .
#Text=Do n't use your hands -- use a metal or plastic utensil of some sort .
#Text=Clean the containers and dry them thoroughly .
#Text=It 's important to use sanitary , clean tubes for your glowsticks .
#Text=The last thing you want is other substances interacting with the reactions you 're depending on to make the substances glow .
#Text=Set the correct lid next to each container .
#Text=This enables you to seal the containers quickly after filling .
#Text=It 's not like the glow will get up and run away from you , but still .
#Text=Combine equal amounts of the first and second solution in the container and close the bottles .
#Text=Shake them up once the lids are on tightly .
#Text=Then turn off the lights !
#Text=If it 's not already glowing , something went wrong .
#Text=Do over !
#Text=Watch as the chemical compound creates a colorful glow .
#Text=Take your glowsticks to the party and charge your friends loads of money for them !
#Text=But act quickly ...
#Text=the glow wo n't last very long .
#Text=Expectations crushed ?
#Text=Method two to the rescue !
#Text=The reaction that the luminol and hydrogen peroxide creates does n't last long at all -- maybe a couple of minutes .
#Text=For something that lasts hours , go to the next method ( which is a lot easier to facilitate if you have access to a laboratory , but it 's still worth mentioning ) .

#Text=This guide to making a glowstick suggests using protective clothing and mixing hydrogen peroxide and water in one bowl , then luminol , sodium carbonate , copper sulfate , ammonium carbonate ( available from websites such as Alfa Aesar or Sigma Aldrich ) and water in another , and finally mixing some of both solutions in a bottle to create the glow .
